persuasion_techniques.name: Authority
persuasion_techniques.description: People are conditioned to respond to authority figures/authority clues

persuasion_techniques.name: Social Proof
persuasion_techniques.description: People determine the appropriateness of their actions and behaviours by looking to the actions and behaviours of others

persuasion_techniques.name: Liking Similarity and Deception
persuasion_techniques.description: People are more likely to comply with someone they know, like and with whom they share interests, ideals and wants

persuasion_techniques.name: Distraction
persuasion_techniques.description: Focusing on potential gains, losses, or emotional triggers can lead people to overlook important factors when making decisions.

persuasion_techniques.name: Commitment, Integrity and Reciprocation
persuasion_techniques.description: Reciprocating a favour or responding to some action can be an automatic response that is linked to a sense of commitment with a previous situation
